docs.lead_paragraph: Fees paid to Christian Science practitioners and chiropractors may be claimed as medical deductions by an income-tax payer. Under certain circumstances, he may deduct the cost of whisky-- in limited quantities--if the "medicine" had been ordered by his physician.

headline.main: Personal Finance; Taxpayer Faces Wide Array of Rules Governing Medical Deduction Claims

docs.abstract: Article on IRS rules on med deductions
docs.snippet: Fees paid to Christian Science practitioners and chiropractors may be claimed as medical deductions by an income-tax payer. Under certain circumstances, he may  deduct the cost of whisky-- in limited quantities--if the "medicine" had been ordered by...

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 1-- John W. Gardner, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, recommended today a broad program that would combine Government aid and Government influence to slow the rising cost of medical care.

headline.main: U.S. Seeks to Curb Fees for Hospitals, Doctors and Drugs; U.S. Curb Urged on Rising Cost Of Doctors, Drugs and Hospitals

docs.abstract: Sec Gardner proposed broad program of Govt aid and Govt influence to slow rising cost of med care, rept to Johnson; details
